org.activity.distances

Class AlignmentBasedDistance

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.activity.distances.AlignmentBasedDistance
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CombinedLevelsEditDistance, FeatureWiseEditDistance, FeatureWiseWeightedEditDistance, HJEditDistance, OTMDSAM2, OTMDSAMEditDistance

    public class AlignmentBasedDistance
extends java.lang.Object
    Note: this has been modified for Geolife data set to account for the additional attributes from geolocation IT IS ADVISED NOT TO CREATE ANY STATIC METHOD IN THIS CLASS
    Author:
    gunjan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AlignmentBasedDistance()
      Sets the tolerance according the truth value of Constant.useTolerance, sets with weights and costs to be used (using the default insert(=1), delete (=1), replace wts (=2))

      static Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getMySimpleLevenshteinDistancePair(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2, int insertWt, int deleteWt, int replaceWt)
      Created as a glue for older code in the process of refactoring to v4 of getMySimpleLevenshteinDistance
      static Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getMySimpleLevenshteinDistanceSlower1(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2, int insertWt, int deleteWt, int replaceWt)
      Computes Levenshtein distance between the given strings.
      Weight of insertion = insertWt * abs(diff(insertedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
      Weight of deletion = deleteWt * abs(diff(deletedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
      Weight of replacement = replaceWt * abs(diff(replaceVal - original)) right to left: insertion? top to down: deletion
      static Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getMySimpleLevenshteinDistanceSlower2(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2, int insertWt, int deleteWt, int replaceWt)
      Fork of org.activity.distances.AlignmentBasedDistance.getMySimpleLevenshteinDistance(String, String, int, int, int) for faster performance by optimising string concatenation.
      static Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getMySimpleLevenshteinDistanceV2(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2, int insertWt, int deleteWt, int replaceWt)
      faster v2
      static double getMySimpleLevenshteinDistanceWithoutTrace(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2, int insertWt, int deleteWt, int replaceWt)
      Computes Levenshtein distance between the given strings.
      Weight of insertion = insertWt * abs(diff(insertedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
      Weight of deletion = deleteWt * abs(diff(deletedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
      Weight of replacement = replaceWt * abs(diff(replaceVal - original)) right to left: insertion? top to down: deletion

      Computes Weighted Levenshtein distance between the given strings.
      Weight of insertion = insertWt * abs(diff(insertedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
      Weight of deletion = deleteWt * abs(diff(deletedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
      Weight of replacement = replaceWt * abs(diff(replaceVal - original)) right to left: insertion? top to down: deletion NOT SYMMETRIC
      Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getWeightedLevenshteinDistanceRawValsForGeoCoordinates(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2, int insertWt, int deleteWt, int replaceWt, Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>[] vals1, Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>[] vals2)
      Computes Weighted Levenshtein distance between the given strings.
      Weight of insertion = insertWt * abs(haversinediff(insertedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
      Weight of deletion = deleteWt * abs(haversinediff(deletedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
      Weight of replacement = replaceWt * abs(haversinediff(replaceVal - original)) right to left: insertion? top to down: deletion NOT SYMMETRIC

      • getFeatureLevelDistance

        public double getFeatureLevelDistance(ActivityObject ao1,
                                      ActivityObject ao2)
        Return the feature level distance between the two given Activity Objects. (note: this is NOT case-based) (note: DCU data has only two features while Geolife Data has 4 additional features. Alert: this method needs to be modified for different datasets.

        TODO To make it generic, store the feature names in a data structure at the start of experiments.) NOT GENERIC this is a fork of HJEditDistance.getFeatureLevelDistance()

        Parameters:
        ao1 -
        ao2 -
        Returns:

        Return the feature level differences between the two given Activity Objects. (note: this is NOT case-based) (note: DCU data has only two features while Geolife Data has 4 additional features. Alert: this method needs to be modified for different datasets.

        TODO To make it generic, store the feature names in a data structure at the start of experiments.) NOT GENERIC

        ao2 -
        Returns:
        EnumMap{GowallaFeatures, Double}, map of Gowalla features and corresonding feature's difference between the two compared act objs ao1 and ao2

      • getWeightedLevenshteinDistanceRawValsForGeoCoordinates

        public Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getWeightedLevenshteinDistanceRawValsForGeoCoordinates(java.lang.String word1,
                                                                                                      java.lang.String word2,
                                                                                                      int insertWt,
                                                                                                      int deleteWt,
                                                                                                      int replaceWt,
                                                                                                      Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>[] vals1,
                                                                                                      Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>[] vals2)
        Computes Weighted Levenshtein distance between the given strings.
        Weight of insertion = insertWt * abs(haversinediff(insertedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
        Weight of deletion = deleteWt * abs(haversinediff(deletedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
        Weight of replacement = replaceWt * abs(haversinediff(replaceVal - original)) right to left: insertion? top to down: deletion NOT SYMMETRIC
        Parameters:
        word1 -
        word2 -
        insertWt -
        deleteWt -
        replaceWt -
        vals1 -
        vals2 - feature timeline vals for current timeline
        Returns:

        faster v4: minimising splits to improve performance

        Fork of org.activity.distances.AlignmentBasedDistance.getMySimpleLevenshteinDistance(String, String, int, int, int) for faster performance by optimising string concatenation. ref: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10078912/best-practices-performance-mixing-stringbuilder-append-with-string-concat

        Computes Levenshtein distance between the given strings.
        Weight of insertion = insertWt * abs(diff(insertedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
        Weight of deletion = deleteWt * abs(diff(deletedVal - medianValOfOtherString))
        Weight of replacement = replaceWt * abs(diff(replaceVal - original)) right to left: insertion? top to down: deletion

        Parameters:
        word1 -
        word2 -
        insertWt -
        deleteWt -
        replaceWt -
        Returns:
        Triple{resultantTrace, resultantDistance, Triple{DISNTrace,coordTraces.getFirst(), coordTraces.getSecond()}}

        Trace =_I(0-1)_I(0-2)_I(0-3)_D(1-3)_D(2-3)_D(3-3)_N(4-4)
        simpleLevenshteinDistance112=6.0
        DINSTrace=IIIDDDN
        third_second=[0, 0, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4]
        third_third=[1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 3, 4]

        Since:
        Mar 1, 2018

        Weight of replacement = replaceWt * abs(diff(replaceVal - original)) right to left: insertion? top to down: deletion
